name: Ingrounds - Drainage
Details
ITP/Checklist for Ingrounds - Drainage
Description of work zone (e. location/drawing grid reference)
Installation complies with AS/NZS-3500 (2021), current IFC drawings & specifications
Inspection openings and/or clean outs have been installed
All drains are clear of debris and have been securely capped
Invert levels for drains and inspection openings have been checked against current IFC drawings
All drains have been tested
All drains have been backfilled and compaction completed
Overflow relief gully has been installed to AS/3500 (2021)
Ingrounds - Pumpwells/Tanks/Pits
Details
ITP/Checklist for Ingrounds - Installation of pumpwells/tanks/pits
Description of work zone (e. location/drawing grid reference)
Installation complies with AS/NZS-3500 (2021), current IFC drawings & specifications
Installation methods & materials are in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Invert levels for inlets, outlets and cover levels have been checked against current IFC drawings
Connection of drainage to pumpwell/tank/pit has been sealed/caulked/grouted both inside and outside
Cast in conduits to pump control panels are correctly sized and in accordance with current IFC drawings
Ingrounds - Cast in
Details
ITP/Checklist for Ingrounds - cast in elements
Description of work zone (e. suction lines within location/drawing grid reference)
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings
All pipe elements free of damage prior to install
Where practical, pipes water tested prior to the pour
Pipe grades and size have been checked
Invert levels and finished levels have been checked
PVC has been lagged (add photos)
HDPE fusion welds are witness marked
All cast in elements are clear of debris, securely capped & sealed prior to pour
Water has been poured into PVC for deep beam/thick slab pour
Unfixed pipes are tied to reo (where necessary)
Details of cast in element
Location and description of what has been cast in (eg pumplines, trade waste, greasy waste etc)

Drains: Underslung - Sewer, Stormwater & Vent
Details
ITP/Checklist for underslung/suspended drains (sewer, stormwater and vents)
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings
Installation materials used in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Penos above have been checked, opened and debris cleared
Clips, fixings & anchor points are correct (including a clip to support each trap & bend)
Pipe & trap invert levels have been checked and are correct
Pipes & traps are clear of debris
Required fall/grade meets AS/NZS 3500 (2021)
Any open ends have been sealed (including the penos above slab)
Labels have been applied
Pipes requiring lagging have been temporarily labelled
Main Run Rough In (Cold Water)
Details
ITP/Checklist for the main CW run from riser to tenancy/bathrooms/apartments/hotel rooms
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings & AS/NZS 3500 (2021)
Installation materials used in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Pipe joints & witness marks are correct (for pex & copper)
Clips and fixings are correct
Pipe run position & levels are correct
All pipework is clear of debris and any open ends sealed (with duct tape if temporary measure required)
Valve flow direction & disconnection unions are correct
Extension points have sacrificial valves
Connected to meter manifold and pipe labelled with destination
Final check for cross connections has been undertaken
Check pipe clear spacing (service separation min 25mm has been achieved)
Labels have been applied
Rough in is ready for a hydrostatic water test

Rough In: House Water Services (High & Low Level Rough In)
Details
Pressure Pipework (for high & low level rough-in) checked off as below
Install Phase
If Pex is being insulated with armaflex, a barrier of duct tape has been applied to all pex crimp fittings
All joints have been crimped correctly and to manufacturers spec
Leak detection indicator has broken away and 3 crimp lines are visible on the crimped fitting
Spacing of clips and fixings for WaterPex as per AS3500.1.2021
Any Pex through metal studs is entirely protected from sharp edges (achieve through additional oversized sleeving or suitable grommets)
Check has been undertaken to ensure no cross connections
Rough In Fitting Install
Installation and location of tempering valve or T.M.V is correct (must be within access panel area)
Location of shower mixer is as per latest IFC
Location of lugged elbow is as per latest IFC
Location of WC water point is as per latest IFC
Location of vanity water points are as per latest IFC
Location of kitchen water points are as per latest IFC
Location of laundry water points are as per latest IFC
Fit Off/ Fixture Install - Toilets & Cisterns
Details
ITP/Checklist for fit off of toilet and cistern (this is not a commissioning ITP)
Installation complies with current IFC shop drawings & AS/NZS 3500 (2021)
Installation materials used in accordance with manufacturer requirements
Fixture has been checked for damage. Damaged fixtures do not get installed
Installation is aligned, level and secure
Flush pipe has been measured to suit the pan prior to being cut to size
Button flush plate is in working order and not damaged/scratched
Seat and accessories are secure and correct
DDA suite back rest installed correctly
Full visual inspection undertaken and all required elements having been installed
Pan trap is clear of debris
Flexible connections are correct with no twisting or kinks
Fixture has been left covered and protected and the area is clean

Testing - Potable Water - 1500kpa water test (not an air test)
Details
ITP/Checklist for undertaking a hydrostatic test at 1500kPa
Water test is being conducted on material that is rated to withstand 1500kpa
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
All in-wall mixer assemblies & pressure sensitive meters, etc have been isolated/removed from the test zone (these items are only rated to max 500kpa)
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Test consisted of slowly increasing the pressure to 1500kpa with the water feed shut off and the pressure held for not less than 30mins
Pressure in the testing area was slowly reduced back to neutral working conditions
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Potable Water - 500kpa water test pressure sensitive valves (not an air test)
Details
ITP/Checklist for undertaking a hydrostatic test to 500kPa to accommodate pressure sensitive fittings
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Test consisted of slowly increasing the pressure to 500kpa with the water feed shut off and the pressure held for not less than 30mins
Pressure in the testing area was slowly reduced back to neutral working conditions
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing Potable Water - (1.5 times maximum working pressure)
Details
ITP/Checklist for water test on fittings that can not be tested to 1500 kPa as per manufacturer's guidelines
Water test is being conducted on material that is rated to withstand BELOW 1500kpa
All valves dedicated to isolating the test zone have been securely shut off & tagged
Air purging valve point has been nominated
Pressure testing valve point has been nominated (if none at meter manifold)
Ensure isolating valves within the test zone are open as required
All terminal open ends i.e. lugged elbows, etc are securely capped off
All in-wall mixer assemblies & pressure sensitive meters, etc have been isolated/removed from the test zone (these items are only rated to max 500kpa)
Feeder valve was slowly opened & the test zone has filled with water until completely purged of any air
Electric pressure testing pump device was connected to the nominated test point
Electric pressure testing pump is calibrated
Test consisted of slowly increasing the pressure to one a half times the working pressure and the pressure held for not less than 30mins
Pressure in the testing area was slowly reduced back to neutral working conditions
Pressure reading photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Water Hold - Sewer & Stormwater Underslung
Details
ITP/Checklist for water hold test of underslung sewer & stormwater drainage
Pipe has been checked and is clear of blockage
Pipe work is securely clipped and ready to hold water
Open ends have been sealed
Test was conducted from stack riser 1m above the highest overflow point
Test was successful as it held water at an unchanged level for at least 30mins
Water was drained from the pipe at the end of the test
Water level photos must be taken at start & finish of test. Add in comments (test duration etc)
Testing - Air Test - Stormwater & Downpipe
Details
Test Phase (stormwater)
The stormwater drainage pipe has been filled with air as per section 9.4.2 of AS3500.3.2021
Pressure of 30 kPa has been applied to the drain and maintained at this pressure for 3mins (with compressor remaining operational for air temp to stablize)
Compressor was shut off and the time taken for the pressure to drop from 25 kPa to 20 kPa was greater than 90sec for DN 225 or smaller (or 180secs for DN 300 or DN 375)
Start of test: Note start time and include photo of calibrated gauge at the start of 90sec (or 180sec) test
End of test: Note end time and include photo of photo of calibrated gauge at the end of 90sec (or 180sec) test
The test has been deemed successful
Test Phase (for downpipe)
The internal downpipe been filled with air as per section 9.3.1 of AS3500.3.2021
Pressure of 30 kPa has been applied to the drain and maintained at this pressure for not less than 3mins
Start of test: Note start time and include photo of calibrated gauge at the start of 3min test
End of test: Note end time and include photo of calibrated gauge at the end of 3min test
The test has been deemed successful
Testing - Air Test - Sewer
Details
Test Phase
The sewer drainage pipe has been filled with air as per section 15.3 of AS3500.2.2021
Pressure of approx 15 kPa has been applied to the drain. When approx 15 kPa has been reached, the compressor has been shut off
Air pressure has been stablised for not less than 3 min while checking for leaks
After the pressure has stablised, commence the test when the pressure has fallen to 10 kPa
Record the time and drop in pressure over the minimum test duration depending on pipe size (eg, 100DN = 2min test)
Start of test: Note start time and include photo of include photo of calibrated gauge at the start of test
End of test: Note end time and include photo of include photo of calibrated gauge at the end of test
The test has been deemed successful if the pressure does not drop more than 3 kPa over the test duration

Details
Hot water plant has been installed as per IFC drawings

All pumps have been installed
Hot water plant is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer

Details
Sewer pumpwell/s has been installed as per IFC drawings
Testing of all pumplines have been undertaken
Pumpwell lid has been lifted and all formwork has been stripped
Rails and lifting chains are in place
Correct specification of pump/s have been delivered and are ready for a pre-priming the day prior to commissioning
Sewer pumpwell is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer

Details
Stormwater pumpwell/s has been installed as per IFC drawings
Testing of all pumplines has been undertaken
Pumpwell lid has been lifted and all formwork has been stripped
Rails and lifting chains are in place
Correct specification of pump/s have been delivered and are ready for a pre-priming the day prior to commissioning
Stormwater pumpwell is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer
Pumpwell lid has been resecured and lid fixings resecured
Plant & Equipment Install - Stormwater Treatment System/Filter
Details
Stormwater treatment system/filter has been installed as per IFC drawings
Testing of all supply lines has been undertaken
Filter lid has been lifted and all formwork has been stripped
Rails and lifting chains are in place
Stormwater treatment system/filter is generally a SPEL/ Gross Pollutant Trap/First Flush/Rain Garden
Stormwater treatment/filter is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer
Pumpwell lid has been resecured and lid fixings resecured
Plant & Equipment Install - Rainwater Tank
Details
Rainwater tank has been installed as per IFC drawings
Testing of all pumplines has been undertaken
If underground, tank lid has been lifted and all formwork has been stripped
Flow control valve (eg Bermad) has been installed and is watermarked
Ensure float connection is secure and will be part of the commissioning by supplier (note, if the float comes off, it will lead to overfow issues)
Overflow is positioned 50mm above highest float setting (this is critical)
There is a physical air break from the tank-fill pipe height to the height of the overflow
Float is connected to the diversion valve
Correct specification of pump/s have been delivered and are ready for a pre-priming the day prior to commissioning
Rainwater tank & pump is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer
Lid has been resecured and lid fixings resecured
Plant & Equipment Install - Rainwater Filtration System
Details
Rrainwater treatment system/filter has been installed as per IFC drawings
Testing of all supply lines has been undertaken
Rainwater treatment/filter is ready for commissioning by supplier/manufacturer
If specified, provision for BMS connection

ITP/Checklist for commissioning TMV and temp testing each tap/mixer

Hot water delivery temperature to be logged

Comm/HO - Apartment Final Commissioning - Fixture Group
Details
ITP/Checklist for final commissioning of all installed fixtures
Bathroom/WC Area
Final check for cross connection for all fixtures has occurred
All cover plates & mixer handles are securely fastened and defect free
Water pressure has been tested and hot & cold water through all fixtures do not exceed 500kPa
Hot water delivery does not exceed 50degC on any fixtures
For SDA or DDA areas only, hot water delivery does not exceed 45degC on any fixtures
WC toilet seat and lid secured and fastened with soft close function operating
All fixtures have been run, sinks plugged for water hold test, and under sink traps checked for any evidence of leaking
All fixtures have been tested for any evidence of water hammer
Wet area grated outlets are installed correctly
A visual inspection to ensure all traps & wastes are clear of debris
Laundry Area
Final check for cross connection for all fixtures has occurred
All cover plates & mixer handles are securely fastened and defect free
Mini stops/trivalve have been securely capped for future washing machine connection by others
Water pressure has been tested and hot & cold water through all fixtures do not exceed 500kPa
Hot water delivery does not exceed 65degC
Trough tap has been run, sink plugged for water hold test, and under sink trap checked for any evidence of leaking
Trough tap has been tested for any evidence of water hammer
Wet area grated outlets are installed correctly
A visual inspection to ensure all traps & wastes are clear of debris
Kitchen
Final check for cross connection for all fixtures has occurred
All cover plates & mixer handles are securely fastened and defect free
Pullout mixer function has been checked and has clear
Water pressure has been tested and hot & cold water through all fixtures do not exceed 500kPa
Hot water delivery in the kitchen does not exceed 65degC
All fixtures have been run, sink plugged for water hold test, and under sink trap checked for any evidence of leaking
All fixtures have been tested for any evidence of water hammer
Dishwasher has been run through a short cycle
